# Week 6

# 9/24 - Introduction: The Age of Thoroughbass

Today we'll dive into the Baroque period. Our focus will be on the method of accompanying from a thoroughbass. This seemingly minor technical innovation was actually so important to baroque composers and performers that the baroque period has been called "The Age of Thoroughbass." We'll introduce two pieces by Monteverdi that use thoroughbass accompaniments, and we'll also take a moment to revisit two of the madrigals from the last unit.

  • Introduction to the Baroque
    • Revisiting Il lamento d'Arianna and "Cruda Amarilli"
    • Thoroughbass and continuo accompaniment
    • Monteverdi, Orfeo, "Tu sei morta"
  • Review of figured bass symbols
  • Guidelines for interpreting unfigured basses
  • The "Lament Bass"
    • Monteverdi, "Il lamento della ninfa" (from the Eighth Book of Madrigals)

Terms: Thoroughbass, Basso continuo Figured bass, Unfigured bass, realization, reduction, Lament bass, opera, Stile recitativo.

Handout: Il lamento della ninfa Handout: Figured Bass Notation Handout: Early Unfigured Bass Guideliness

# 9/25 - Drill

Today in drill we'll review the "Lament Bass" pattern and then work on harmonizing an unfigured bass by Monteverdi.

  • Review: The lament bass
  • Exercise: Devising an accompaniment for "Si dolce e il tormento"

# 9/26 - Basso ostinato variations

Today we'll be looking at several basso ostinato, or "Ground Bass" patterns, and at a few pieces that use them. We'll also discuss another great English composer: Henry Purcell.

  • HW5 (due next Monday)
  • Ostinato basses and variations
    • The Passacaglia
    • The Ciacona (chaconne)
    • The Follia
  • Corelli, Ciacona (Trio Sonata in G, Op. 2, no. 12)
  • Some background on Purcell

Handout: The Rule of the Octave

Terms: Basso ostinato, ground bass, variation, Passacaglia, ciacona, follia.
